name: OpenHomity
tagline: Extensible Open Source Home Automation Suite
body:
### Welcome to the OpenHomity project!
OpenHomity is an open source home automation suite capable of controlling a variety of objects, including -
* Switches - light, power, etc
* Sensors - digital, analog
* Garage Doors (coming soon)
* Door Locks (coming soon)
* Alarm Systems (coming soon)
* Camera Systems (coming soon)

This project is written such that each of the above objects is abstracted from any specific vendor or implementation, so new devices can be supported through pluggable drivers written by users or vendors themselves.

### Components

### Getting started
## What you'll need

* A hardhat
    * This project is in very early stages, so there is some assembly required
* A linux server
    * This can be any type of server or distribution you like
    * The code is lightweight enough to run fine on a Raspberry Pi
* One or more "spoke" devices
    * Arduino Uno ethernet

## Setting it up
### Installing, Configuring, & Starting the Hub
```
# Install Needed Linux & Python Packages
$ sudo apt-get install -y git couchdb python-pip curl python-dev libssl-dev
$ sudo pip install couchdb flask pyopenssl

# Create Log/Config Directories
$ sudo mkdir /etc/homity/
$ sudo chown <your_linux_username> /etc/homity
$ sudo mkdir /var/log/homity
$ sudo chown <your_linux_username> /var/log/homity

# Clone Git Repo Into HomeDir, Run Initial Setup Script
$ cd ~
$ git clone git://github.com/openhomity/homity-hub.git
$ cd homity-hub/
$ python initialsetup.py <hub_user_username> <hub_user__password>
# -- Replace args with username & password you want clients to use when connecting.

# Start The Server
$ python runhub.py &
```

### Install & Configure the Client
```
# Install Needed Linux & Python Packages
$ sudo pip install requests prettytable six

# Create Config Directory <-- if setting up on different machine than the Hub
$ sudo mkdir /etc/homity/
$ sudo chown <your_linux_username> /etc/homity

# Clone the Git repo
$ cd ~
$ git clone git://github.com/openhomity/homity-client.git

# Configure with username & password
$ cd homity-client/
$ cp default.conf /etc/homity/homityclient.conf
$ vi /etc/homity/homityclient.conf 
# -- Set username & password to hub_user_username and hub_user_password set during hub setup.  Set server if Hub is remote.

# Make alias to easily run CLIs.
$ echo alias homity=\'python ~/homity-client/homityshell.py\' >> ~/.bash-aliases
```
